intro: Paraphlomis koreana, commonly known as Korean false spurge, is a perennial herb native to Korea. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
